docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: filter_data(data, key=None, reverse=False)
docs.text:
Filters and sorts data based on criteria.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default data list

The data to filter.

required key callable

A function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key. Defaults to None.

None reverse bool

If True, sort in descending order. Defaults to False.

False

Returns:

Name Type Description list

A new filtered and sorted list.

Raises:

Type Description TypeError

If data is not a list.

Source code in module1\file_a.py 
def filter_data(data, key=None, reverse=False):
    """
    Filters and sorts data based on criteria.

    Args:
        data (list): The data to filter.
        key (callable, optional): A function of one argument that is used to extract 
                                 a comparison key. Defaults to None.
        reverse (bool, optional): If True, sort in descending order. Defaults to False.

    Returns:
        list: A new filtered and sorted list.

    Raises:
        TypeError: If data is not a list.
    """
    pass

docs.title: merge_lists(*lists)
docs.text:
Merges multiple lists into a single list.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default *lists

Variable length argument list of lists to merge.

()

Returns:

Name Type Description list

A new list containing all elements from input lists in order.

Example

merge_lists([1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]) [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]

Source code in module1\file_a.py 
def merge_lists(*lists):
    """
    Merges multiple lists into a single list.

    Args:
        *lists: Variable length argument list of lists to merge.

    Returns:
        list: A new list containing all elements from input lists in order.

    Example:
        >>> merge_lists([1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6])
        [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
    """
    pass

def process_text(text, uppercase=False, remove_spaces=False):
    """
    Processes text with various transformations.

    Args:
        text (str): The input text to process.
        uppercase (bool, optional): If True, convert text to uppercase. Defaults to False.
        remove_spaces (bool, optional): If True, remove all whitespace. Defaults to False.

    Returns:
        str: The processed text.

    Raises:
        TypeError: If text is not a string.
    """
    pass

    Args:
        path (str): The file path to read from.

    Returns:

    Raises:
        FileNotFoundError: If the file does not exist.
        IOError: If an error occurs while reading the file.

If True, append to the file; if False, overwrite. Defaults to False.

Name Type Description bool

If an error occurs while writing to the file.

def write_file(path, content, append=False):
    """
    Writes or appends content to a file.

    Args:
        path (str): The file path to write to.
        content (str): The content to write to the file.
        append (bool, optional): If True, append to the file; if False, overwrite. 
                                Defaults to False.

    Returns:
        bool: True if the operation was successful, False otherwise.

    Raises:
        IOError: If an error occurs while writing to the file.
    """
    pass

docs.title: AdvancedTool(name, version='2.0', enabled=True, log_file=None, timeout=30)
docs.text:
Bases: BaseTool

Advanced tool with additional features and logging capabilities.

This class extends BaseTool with advanced features such as logging, error handling, and performance monitoring.

Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

The name of the tool.

version str

The version of the tool.

enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled.

log_file str

Path to the log file.

timeout int

Maximum execution time in seconds.

Initialize the AdvancedTool.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default name str

The name of the tool.

required version str

The version of the tool. Defaults to "2.0".

'2.0' enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.

True log_file str

Path to store logs. Defaults to None.

None timeout int

Maximum execution time in seconds. Defaults to 30.

30 Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def __init__(self, name, version="2.0", enabled=True, log_file=None, timeout=30):
    """
    Initialize the AdvancedTool.

    Args:
        name (str): The name of the tool.
        version (str, optional): The version of the tool. Defaults to "2.0".
        enabled (bool, optional): Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.
        log_file (str, optional): Path to store logs. Defaults to None.
        timeout (int, optional): Maximum execution time in seconds. Defaults to 30.
    """
    super().__init__(name, version, enabled)
    self.log_file = log_file
    self.timeout = timeout
    self.execution_count = 0

docs.title: get_stats()
docs.text:
Get execution statistics for the tool.

Returns:

Name Type Description dict

Dictionary containing execution statistics.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def get_stats(self):
    """
    Get execution statistics for the tool.

    Returns:
        dict: Dictionary containing execution statistics.
    """
    return {
        "name": self.name,
        "execution_count": self.execution_count,
        "timeout": self.timeout
    }

docs.title: run()
docs.text:
Execute the advanced tool with logging and monitoring.

Returns:

Name Type Description dict

A dictionary containing execution results and metadata.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def run(self):
    """
    Execute the advanced tool with logging and monitoring.

    Returns:
        dict: A dictionary containing execution results and metadata.
    """
    self.execution_count += 1
    print(f"Running advanced tool: {self.name}")
    return {
        "status": "success",
        "tool_name": self.name,
        "execution_count": self.execution_count,
        "timeout": self.timeout
    }

docs.title: BaseTool(name, version='1.0', enabled=True)
docs.text:
Base class for all tool implementations.

This is the parent class that defines the interface for all tools in the system. Subclasses should override the run() method to provide specific functionality.

Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

The name of the tool.

version str

The version of the tool.

enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled or disabled.

Initialize the BaseTool.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default name str

The name of the tool.

required version str

The version of the tool. Defaults to "1.0".

'1.0' enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.

True Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def __init__(self, name, version="1.0", enabled=True):
    """
    Initialize the BaseTool.

    Args:
        name (str): The name of the tool.
        version (str, optional): The version of the tool. Defaults to "1.0".
        enabled (bool, optional): Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.
    """
    self.name = name
    self.version = version
    self.enabled = enabled

docs.title: get_info()
docs.text:
Retrieve information about the tool.

Returns:

Name Type Description dict

A dictionary containing tool metadata.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def get_info(self):
    """
    Retrieve information about the tool.

    Returns:
        dict: A dictionary containing tool metadata.
    """
    return {
        "name": self.name,
        "version": self.version,
        "enabled": self.enabled
    }

docs.title: run()
docs.text:
Execute the tool's main functionality.

This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide specific implementation details.

Returns:

Name Type Description str

A message describing the execution result.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def run(self):
    """
    Execute the tool's main functionality.

    This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide
    specific implementation details.

    Returns:
        str: A message describing the execution result.
    """
    print(f"Running base tool: {self.name}")
    return f"Base tool {self.name} executed."

docs.title: CustomTool(name, version='1.0', enabled=True, custom_config=None)
docs.text:
Bases: BaseTool

Custom tool implementation that extends BaseTool.

This class inherits from BaseTool and provides custom functionality while maintaining the same interface.

Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

The name of the tool.

version str

The version of the tool.

enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled.

custom_config dict

Custom configuration for this tool.

Initialize the CustomTool.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default name str

The name of the tool.

required version str

The version of the tool. Defaults to "1.0".

'1.0' enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.

True custom_config dict

Custom configuration dictionary. Defaults to None.

None Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def __init__(self, name, version="1.0", enabled=True, custom_config=None):
    """
    Initialize the CustomTool.

    Args:
        name (str): The name of the tool.
        version (str, optional): The version of the tool. Defaults to "1.0".
        enabled (bool, optional): Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.
        custom_config (dict, optional): Custom configuration dictionary. Defaults to None.
    """
    super().__init__(name, version, enabled)
    self.custom_config = custom_config or {}

docs.title: run()
docs.text:
Execute the custom tool with enhanced functionality.

Returns:

Name Type Description str

A message describing the custom execution result.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def run(self):
    """
    Execute the custom tool with enhanced functionality.

    Returns:
        str: A message describing the custom execution result.
    """
    print(f"Running custom tool: {self.name}")
    return f"Custom tool {self.name} executed with config: {self.custom_config}"

docs.title: PluginTool(name, version='3.0', enabled=True, log_file=None, timeout=30, plugins=None)
docs.text:
Bases: AdvancedTool

Plugin-based tool that extends AdvancedTool with plugin capabilities.

This class adds support for loading and managing plugins, extending the functionality of the advanced tool.

Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

The name of the tool.

version str

The version of the tool.

enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled.

log_file str

Path to the log file.

timeout int

Maximum execution time in seconds.

plugins list

List of loaded plugins.

Initialize the PluginTool.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default name str

The name of the tool.

required version str

The version of the tool. Defaults to "3.0".

'3.0' enabled bool

Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.

True log_file str

Path to store logs. Defaults to None.

None timeout int

Maximum execution time in seconds. Defaults to 30.

30 plugins list

List of plugins to load. Defaults to None.

None Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def __init__(self, name, version="3.0", enabled=True, log_file=None, timeout=30, plugins=None):
    """
    Initialize the PluginTool.

    Args:
        name (str): The name of the tool.
        version (str, optional): The version of the tool. Defaults to "3.0".
        enabled (bool, optional): Whether the tool is enabled. Defaults to True.
        log_file (str, optional): Path to store logs. Defaults to None.
        timeout (int, optional): Maximum execution time in seconds. Defaults to 30.
        plugins (list, optional): List of plugins to load. Defaults to None.
    """
    super().__init__(name, version, enabled, log_file, timeout)
    self.plugins = plugins or []

docs.title: add_plugin(plugin_name)
docs.text:
Add a plugin to the tool.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default plugin_name str

The name of the plugin to add.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description bool

True if plugin was added successfully, False otherwise.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def add_plugin(self, plugin_name):
    """
    Add a plugin to the tool.

    Args:
        plugin_name (str): The name of the plugin to add.

    Returns:
        bool: True if plugin was added successfully, False otherwise.
    """
    if plugin_name not in self.plugins:
        self.plugins.append(plugin_name)
        return True
    return False

docs.title: run()
docs.text:
Execute the plugin tool with all loaded plugins.

Returns:

Name Type Description dict

Dictionary containing execution results and plugin information.

Source code in module3\file_f.py 
def run(self):
    """
    Execute the plugin tool with all loaded plugins.

    Returns:
        dict: Dictionary containing execution results and plugin information.
    """
    base_result = super().run()
    base_result["plugins"] = self.plugins
    base_result["plugin_count"] = len(self.plugins)
    return base_result
